Access the internet through Proxy server:

The format is specified by a pattern. Within the pattern letters have special meaning.
Text can be quoted using single quotes ('). All other characters are copied to the output.
Use a letter multiple times to specify the field length in the output.
Important letters:
LetterMeaning
yYear
MMonth
dDay in month
HHour in day (0-23)
mMinute in hour
sSecond in minute
Pattern examples:
PatternResult
yyyy.MM.dd2010.07.25
yy-M-D10-7-25
HH:mm:ss14:34:02
MM/dd/yy - HH:m:s12/25/10 - 14:34:2
MM/dd 'at' HH:m12/25 at 14:34
yyMMddHHmmss101225143402
Opens the date and time format specification page.
The entered date/time format is valid.
The current date/time with the entered format:
The entered date/time format is invalid.
If you enter a number here, the same game associated with the number will be played each time.
Paint a cross at the center of discs:
Paint a circle around discs showing maximum size:
Each line is an alias group which contains a comma separated list of player or map aliases. The first alias in each line will be the name of the alias group.
Map names will be replaced by the alias group name. Players and maps in the same alias group will be summarized in the Multi-replay analysis.
Player names must be provided in full format: name/gateway/region/bnetId (ex. "SCIIGears/EU/1/206154"). Right click on a player to copy the full format.
Each line is an element of the selected list. The first line is the initial value so it is recommended to leave it empty.
Sc2gears Database is a secure server to store all your replays and other related files privately.
An Authorization key is required to communicate with the server instead of your password.
You can view your key or generate a new one on this page:
Replay upload will not work for just any replay site! The replay site HAS TO IMPLEMENT the Replay upload specification!
I understand this, enable custom replay sites
(Contact the replay site for the upload URL.)
Used when downloading profile info and maps from the Battle.net server.
Used when checking updates, downloading Start page content and when communicating with the Sc2gears Database.
Used when a connection is made which is not covered by the above 2 proxies (TCP/UDP level).
Also use Proxy when downloading updates

g.t: Read more about Private Video Streaming
Streaming... You may close this window while streaming.

Note: if you are behind a router or a proxy server, your external IP address (visible from the internet)
might be different and the server port you select might not be open (or may be redirected to a different port).
(this will be the end of the stream URL)
Higher value means better video quality, but it results in bigger outgoing bandwidth.

A comma separated list of the full names of watched players.
Tips and things you should know about $0
<html>In order to auto-save replays, display Map view chart, launch StarCraft II etc. ensure folders are set correctly:</html>
Yes, you can change how auto-saved replays are named. Edit the Replay auto-save name template:

By default players are listed as they appear in the replays.
You can put your name to the first place if you add your name to the Favored player list:

By default real time and real APM values are displayed and used which differ from values displayed in StarCraft II.
You can switch back to game time and game APM if you wish here:
<html>$0 can automatically store ALL your replays securely online if you have an Sc2gears Database account:</html>
You can run a diagnostic test to see if your settings are correct:
For advanced users: you should check out the Tips dialog:

Limitation: $0 operates on replays. Replays contain limited amount of information
which sometimes may differ from the actual game (for example more train actions than units actually created).
Yes, $0 and all of its features are legit by Blizzard's terms of use.

g.t: Failed to start $0 plugin(s) out of $1 enabled plugin(s)!
Details (select a test in the table above):
Warning! Games with custom rules are not qualified for the Top Scores table!
If enabled, red discs will not be filled (for color blinds).
This game tests your mouse speed and accuracy.
Your goal is to click on the discs as they appear.
Use the LEFT button for Green discs and the RIGHT button for Red discs.
The closer you click to their center point the more points you get.
Game is over when 10 times you miss a disc or click on the background.
You've made it to #$0 in the Top Scores table!
Unfortunately you can't submit your score because you have no Authorization key set.
Top Score table is restricted to Sc2gears Database users.
Please enter your name to submit your score:
You have to specify the target folder to download files to!
What would you like to do?
The $0 cannot be started because previous post-update failed!

g.c: Tray icon menu. These cannot have hotkeys.

g.t: There are $0 active background job(s). Are you sure you want to exit?
Enter words to filter rows. You can use OR between words. (CTRL+F)
Enter words to filter OUT rows. You can use OR between words. (CTRL+T)
Failed to initialize the internal replay cache! Replay cache service is disabled!
Open in Replay search for further filtering
Are you sure you want to delete "$0"?
You can create and save replay sources on the "Search source" tab of replay searches.
You can save replay lists on the "Results" tab of replay searches.
Are you sure you want to delete $0 replay(s)?

t.c: $0: number of copied replays, $1 number of replays failed to delete

g.t: Successfully copied $0 replay(s) but failed to delete $1 replay(s).
Enter a template for renaming replays.
You can insert any text and you can use symbols for dynamic values.
Symbols will be replaced with the proper values for all replays.
The following symbols can be used:
MD5 hash of the replay (EXTREMELY speeds up analysis and search if added to the name!)
date and time of the replay
counter which starts from 1 and will be incremented by 1 on each use
counter with fixed x digits which starts from 1 and will be incremented by 1 on each use
replay counter with fixed x digits, its value is always the number of replays in the target folder +1
first x words of map name
first xy letters of map name (2 digits!)
map name acronym (first letters of the words of the map)

t.c: $0 symbols that can be used inside this

g.t: Player info block. Use the $0 symbols inside this without indices, and all players grouped by teams will be substituted. Example: </p(/r)>
name of player x (x is the player number starting from 1)
comma separated list of all player names
comma separated list of all player names grouped by teams
comma separated list of the winners
race of player x (x is the player number starting from 1)
first letter of race of player x (x is the player number starting from 1)
1v1 Battle.net league (first letter) of player x (x is the player number starting from 1)
APM of player x (x is the player number starting from 1)
EAPM of player x (x is the player number starting from 1)
tells if player x is winner (x is the player number starting from 1); one letter: $0
Template cannot be an empty string!
Missing symbol char at the end!
Invalid Player info block closing tag!
Player info block is not closed properly!
Player info block cannot be embedded in another block!
Not allowed character in file name: '$0'
You did not provide an Authorization key!
You need a valid Authorization key to store or download files from the Sc2gears Database!
$0 is not affiliated with the replay sites listed below.
It is up to the replay sites whether they require or use the information you provide below.
Choose a replay site to upload to:
If account info is not provided, the replay will be uploaded anonymously.
Some replay sites may not support anonymous upload.
Failed to load shared replay list!
You can load or copy/paste Build orders here, and $0 will simulate a replay creating a player from each provided Build order.
The format of the Build order text can be found here:
Select a file containing a Build order
Select the chart type you want to see. Use CTRL+number to fast switch between them.
Opens the Sc2gears Database User Page
If you associate *.SC2Replay files with Sc2gears.exe, they will be opened in Sc2gears if you double click on them.
Use CTRL+number hotkeys to fast switch between charts.
Tables are sorted by up to 3 columns. 2nd and 3rd sort columns will be the previous sort columns.
You can add a shortcut to Sc2gears.exe in your Startup menu and set Sc2gears to start minimized to tray.
You can export the data of any table in Sc2gears, just press CTRL+C to copy the selected table rows to clipboard.
You can pass any SC2 replays, Sc2gears replay lists and Sc2gears replay sources to Sc2gears.exe, and all will be opened.
Sc2gears replay lists are standard CVS files so you can open them with Excel for example for further processing.
You can set the start folder when opening replays in the Folder settings.
You can narrow a search result by refining the search terms and perform the search again or set the results as source and define new filters.
You can restrict the Multi-rep analysis to any subset of the replays if you pre-filter them in the Replay search.
Use the "Filter actions" and "Filter out actions" fields in the Replay analyzer to display only the actions you're interested in.
You can customize the data displayed on the charts in the Replay analyzer if you select the "Use listed actions..." check box and you filter the actions.
Add your StarCraft 2 account name to the favored player list, and you will always be displayed as the first player.
Use the Full-screen mode (F11) to view charts and everything in big.
Most of the commands and actions have hotkeys. Memorize those to use Sc2gears more efficiently.
If a drop-down list is focused, you can start typing to jump to the element that you're looking for.
Use the "Group by teams" function in the Replay analyzer to easily compare overall team performances.
Use the "Group by teams" function on the Map view chart to display buildings of team members with the same color.
Enable "Minimize to tray on Close" in the Window menu to prevent accidental close of Sc2gears.
In the Results tab of Replay searches you can press ENTER or SHIFT+ENTER to open the selected replays for analysis.
In the Hotkeys chart of Replay analyzer move your mouse over the assigned hotkey numbers to see what units the player assigned to that group.
Every chart can be zoomed in the Replay analyzer. If a chart is zoomed, you can simply drag it to scroll (or traditionally use the scroll bar).
You can disable the "Preload SC2 icons on startup" function for slightly faster startup and smaller initial memory usage.
Press F6 to switch between the navigation tree and the active window.
Press F8 and use the cursor keys to resize the navigation bar.
In the Replay analyzer right click on the charts shows the Replay Operations menu, right click on the player check boxes shows the Player menu.
Saved replay sources and replay lists automatically appear in the navigation tree if (and only if) you save them in the default folder that comes up when saving.
Middle click (net scroll) on the charts in the Replay analyzer enlarges the charts! Middle click again restores the original.
Manual replay rename and the replay auto-save can group your files into sub-folders if you use backslash ("\") for specifying folders in the name template.
You can enter a comma separated list of player names in the search filter to find replays that include all the listed players.
You can export the actions of a replay as text. Simply select the actions you want to export and press CTRL+C to copy them to the clipboard.
You can zoom the charts with CTRL+wheel scroll in the Replay analyzer.
If you have multiple accounts or you used the name change feature of SC2, you can list your names as aliases and statistics will be summarized.
You can list map name aliases to display the name you wish and to summarize statistics for them (for example localized map names).
You can define custom date and time formats on the Internal tab of the Miscellaneous settings dialog.
You can drag and drop replays, folders, replay sources and replay lists onto Sc2gears, and all will be opened respectively.
You can drag and drop replays and folders onto the source list of the Source tab of Replay searches.
Most input text fields can have a pre-defined value list. Add the terms you use often to the pre-defined list.
You can easily apply saved search filters: right click on the replay source or replay list in the navigation tree and choose "Apply filter".
You can run a diagnostic test from the Tools menu if you think something is broken or not working.
You can activate a grid on the charts in the Replay analyzer to see how well you perform periodic tasks like Spawn Larva or Chrono Boost.
Sc2gears can automatically store ALL your files securely online if you have an Sc2gears Database account.
You can change your portrait picture to anything you like, and everyone who opens a replay in Sc2gears with you in it will see that as your portrait.
Rename your replays by adding the MD5 hash of the replays ('/h' symbol) to EXTREMELY speed up search and analysis.
Enable Global hotkeys in the Settings menu and you can control Sc2gears while you're in StarCraft II.
The Game info dialog shows you info about the players you just played without having to ALT+TAB out of StarCraft II.
You can change the size of the On-Top APM display with the + and - keys.
Clicking on the Game info dialog will stop its auto-closing timer.
You can rearrange and hide columns permanently in the Replay list table to your liking if you click on the "Column setup" link above the table.
You can lock On-Top dialogs by right clicking on them and choosing "Lock" to prevent accidental move or close. You can unlock them the same way.
You can enable Proxy configuration if you use Sc2gears from a network which has internet access only through a proxy server, or you use Sc2gears from China.
Record columns in the Multi-rep analysis sort by (wins-losses). You can use this to see which maps to vote down (the bottom of the list).
The replay list table can color wins to green and losses to red if you add your name to the favored player list.
Share/upload multiple replays at once: pass multiple replays to the Share replays dialog, and you can upload all at once or one-by-one with different description.
You can view and edit private replay data directly from Sc2gears on the "Private data" tab of the Replay Analyzer if you have a valid Authorization key.
You can rate and discuss replays on the "Public comments" tab of the Replay analyzer. Your comments remain private if you don't share your replay.
There is a Free Sc2gears Database package for Everyone. You just have to ask. Details are on the home page.
You can share your Sc2gears Database account with your friends, ideal for teams to share their replays with the team. Details are on the home page.
Shows 1 chart for each team with summarized values of the team members.
Displays all players on the same chart.
Use the players' in-game colors for chart drawing.
Display time information in seconds rather than frames.
Select the zoom level. Use CTRL+I to zoom in, CTRL+U to zoom out.
This player is a winner in this game.
This player is a loser in this game.
There are $0 more row(s). Open the profile dialog to view them.
Add to the favored player list
Insert to the favored player list before player
Remove from the favored player list

g.t: Enter first letters of races you're looking for. Symbols: $0 - $1, $2 - $3, $4 - $5, $6 - $7, * to match any race, v - to separate teams. Examples: $8

Enter letters of leagues you're looking for. Use * to match any league, v - to separate teams.

Enter either a date or a full date+time. Example: $0 or $1
Enter a comma separated building list here (case in-sensitive). Use asterisk (*) to match any building.
Add selected building to build order.
Sets all replays as source for further search.
Opens all replays in multi-replay analysis.
